title: A piece of Inca history
caption: A piece of Inca history
desc: It's the 1530s, Spanish conquistadors cemented their hold over the lands of the Incan Empire, including the massive 12th-century stone fortress in today's image: Sacsayhuamán, in the old Inca capital of Cusco. Here, the Spanish held prisoner a man named Manco Inca, the puppet leader they'd installed over the Incans. But one day in the spring of 1536, he escaped.
copyright: Inca fortress of Sacsayhuamán near Cusco, Peru (© Susanne Kremer/eStock Photo)
